dataset.title: Nitrate and Phosphate concentrations at Doñana LTSER Platform (2011-2012)

section.para: Seasonal water sampling for estimation of Nitrates and Phosphates concentration at 4 sites representing the Doñana wetlands diversity (IDL1: Permanent phreatic lagoon, IDL12: Temporary phreatic lagoon, IDL28: Tributary river to the marshland and IDL46: Sesonally flooded marshland)

section.title: Dataset access and use constraints
section.para: Principal:Public has granted a permission of type:Free for access and use upon request

section.title: Dataset legal obligation reporting
section.para: Directive 2000/60/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 October 2000 establishing a framework for Community action in the field of water policy;2000-10-23,publication
Formal acknowledgement of the dataset providers

para.literalLayout: Rédacteur : S. L. Vérificateur : 8 . M. Approbateur : P. C. ALLlANCE METHOOS Parameter: Nitrates -Cadmium Application: Sea water System: FUTURA'MF) Range: 48 -161 1 L 3 -10 N03 I -DESCRIPTION OF THE METHOD: The nitrates are reduced into nitrites in a copper/cadmium column. Nitrites react with sulfanilamid in acid conditions to give a diazo compound. With N-(1-Naphthyl) ethylen diamin, it be comes a pink coloured complex. Colorimetric mesures are performed at 520/540 nm. Cadency : 60 to 80 samples 1hour. 11-REAGENTS PREPARATION : R1 Arnmonium chloride solution Ammonium chloride, NH4CI 10 9 Demineralised water, q.s. 1 000 mi Adjust the pH to 8.5 with ammonium hydroxide, NH40H. J R2 Colour reagent Sulfamilamid, C6 H8 N2 02 S 20 9 Concentrated phosphoric acid, H3P04 85 % 200 mi N-(1-Naphthyl) ethylen diamin dihydrochlorid, C12 H14 N2, 2HCI 0.5 9 Brij-35 (ALLlANCE T21-0110-05) 1 mi Demineralised water, q.s. 2000 mi Add 200 mi H3P04 to 1 500 mi of D.water. Dissolve 20 9 sulfamilamid . Meat if necessary. 0.5 9 Complete up to 2000 mi with D.water. Add 1 mi of 8rij¬Conservatían : 1 month at 4°C and protected from Iight. The cadmium-copper column must be used carefully. The system is run on reagents without the column. Once all reagents are pumped in the analytical circuit, the column is introduced in the circuit without introducing an air buble. At the end af the day, the column is first deconnected and the analytical circuit is then washed. Thus, the calumn remains always in the ammonium chloride solution. Standards preparation Solution 1 000 mg 1I N03 Potassium nitrate, KN03 1.63 9 Demineralised water , q.s. 1 000 mi Dissolve 1.63 9 of potassium nitrate in demineralised water. Add 1 mi of chloroform, CHCI3. Dilute up to 1 000 mi with demineralised water. Stabilitv /Conservatíon : 1 month at 4oC and protected from light. Working standard solution : Dilute stock solution in a about 39 gil of Na CI solution or in sea-water without NH4. Made standards according to the range. Sampler solution : NaCI about 39 gil solution I -DESCRIPTION OF THE METHOD: The ammonium molybdate reacts with the orthophosphates in acid condition to form the phosphomolybdic acid. It is reduced in "molybdene blue" by ascorbic acid. The reaction is catalysed by potassium antimony oxide tartrate. Optical density is measured at the wavelength of 880 nm. -REAGENTS COMPOSITION : Sulfuric acid, about 6 N Sulfuric acid concentrated 95-97 %, H2S04 85 mi O.water, q.s. 500 mi Oissolve 85 mi of concentrated sulfuri9 cid in 200 mi O.water. Cool, adjust to 500 mi with O.water. Ammonium hepta olybdate 4 % Ammonium heptamolybdate tetrahydrate, (NH4)6 M07 024, 4H20 8 9 O.water, q.s. 200 mi Stabilitv I Conservation : about 3 weeks at 4°C in an amber plastic container. J2Potassium antimony-(III) oxide tartrate 0.3 % Potassium antimony-(III) tartrate hemihYdrate(0,5 H20) 0.3 9 -150 mi ammonium heptamolybdate solution 4 % -50 mi potassium antimony oxide tartrate solution 0.3 % -10 mi diluant solution (reagent 3) Stabilitv I Conservation : about 3 weeks at 4 °C. R2 -Ascorbic acid solution Ascorbic acid, C6H806 4.5 9 O.water, q.s. 250 mi Oissolve 4.5 9 of ascorbic acid in 200 mI of O.water. Adjust to 250 mi with O.water. Stabilitvl Conservation : about 3 weeks at 4°C in an amber plastic container. R3-SOS Sg/L Oissolve 5 9 dodecylsulfate, sodium salt in 1 000 mi of distilled water.
